citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A 17.5 year old female Bengal tiger, "Sita", received veterinary care, on facility grounds, on 11/10/2023 for an overgrown
claw. Blood samples collected during examination were consistent with chronic renal disease. The veterinarian discussed
chronic renal failure management and comfort with the owner. The medical notes state that recommendations were made
“to owner regarding diet and always giving the animals access to water; Water must be present 24/7 though he is
welcome to continue to offer water from a pan.” The owner has always only presented water to the animals in a bowl “by
hand” several times a day leaving the animals without continuous access to water. The veterinary report indicates that
"Sita" passed away on 12/29/2023 and at the time of inspection Icelady, the remaining tiger, was being offered water by
hand despite the veterinary recommendations. Failure to follow medical instructions puts an animals’ health and welfare
at risk. Each dealer and exhibitor shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to ensure the
provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use.
Correct by 20 June 2024
This inspection was conducted with the licensee, exit interview was attempted by phone without success.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
